headline.main: U.S. Captive, on Italian Submarine Sunk by British, Tells of Rescue; Flying Officer Says Foe Went 'Nuts' When Destroyers Attacked -- Companion Saved British Fellow-Prisoner From Drowning

lead_paragraph: ALLIED HEADQUARTERS in North Africa, Jan. 31 -- The last-minute rescue by British destroyers that had sunk a submarine carrying five American airmen to an Italian prison camp was described today by Fighter Pilot J.C. Lentz, 25 years old, of Paris, Texas, one of three survivors flown here.
abstract: Describes rescue from Ital submarine sunk by Brit

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES
